gc.name: Timing
gc.desc: Does the control of the process require timing of actions? Are there clear indicators / signals for the timing of actions? Does the system include lead time indications? Does a signal clearly indentify the corresponding action?

sc.name: Too early
sc.desc: An action started too early, before a signal was given or the required conditions had been established. (Premature action)

sc.name: Too late
sc.desc: An action started too late. (Delayed action)

sc.name: Omission
sc.desc: An action that was not done at all (within the time interval allowed).

gc.name: Duration
gc.desc: Is duration a control parameter? Is duration controlled manually or automatically? Is the duration clearly shown or indicated? Does the indication show elapsed time or remaining time, or both?

sc.name: Too long
sc.desc: An action that was continued beyond the point when it should have stopped

sc.name: Too short
sc.desc: An action that was stopped before it should have been.

gc.name: Force
gc.desc: Is level of force / effort a control parameter? Is the required / applied level of force clearly indicated? Is there a minimum/maximum limit of force for a control? Can force be controlled without changing position?

sc.name: Too little
sc.desc: Insufficient force.

sc.name: Too much
sc.desc: Surplus force, too much effort.

gc.name: Distance / magnitude
gc.desc: Is distance or magnitude a control paremeter? Is the required / applied distance or magnitude clearly indicated? Can distance / magnitude be controlled without changing position?

sc.name: Too far
sc.desc: A movement taken too far.

sc.name: Too short
sc.desc: A movement not taken far enough

gc.name: Speed
gc.desc: Is speed a control parameter? Is speed controlled manually or automatically (set-point / rate)? Is the required / applied speed clearly indicated?

sc.name: Too fast
sc.desc: Action performed too quickly, with too much speed or finished too early.

sc.name: Too slow
sc.desc: Action performed too slowly, with too little speed or finished too late.

gc.name: Direction
gc.desc: Is direction a control parameter? Is there a direct relation between (movement) direction of controls and direction of system response? Is the required / applied direction clearly indicated?

sc.name: Wrong direction
sc.desc: Movement in the wrong direction, e.g. forwards instead of backwards or left instead of right.

sc.name: Wrong movement type
sc.desc: The wrong kind of movement, such as pulling a knob instead of turning it.

gc.name: Wrong object
gc.desc: Are different objects clearly separated or coded (colour/shape)? Are objects clearly and uniquely identified? Can objects easily be reached and seen when use is required?

sc.name: Neighbor
sc.desc: An object that is in physical proximity to the object that should have been used.

sc.name: Similar object
sc.desc: An object that is similar in appearance to the object that should have been used.

sc.name: Unrelated object
sc.desc: An object that was used by mistake, even though it had no obvious relation to the object that should have been used

gc.name: Sequence
gc.desc: Is the sequence of actions / next action clearly indicated? Is the direction of the sequence reversible? Can out-of-sequence actions easily be recovered?

sc.name: Omission
sc.desc: An action that was not carried out. This includes in particular the omission of the last action(s) of a series

sc.name: Jump forward
sc.desc: One or more actions in a sequence were skipped.

sc.name: Jump backwards
sc.desc: One or more earlier actions that have been carried out, is carried out again.

sc.name: Repetition
sc.desc: The previous action is repeated.

sc.name: Reversal
sc.desc: The order of two neighboring actions is reversed.

sc.name: Wrong action
sc.desc: An extraneous or irrelevant action is carried out.

sc.name: Overlook cue / signal
sc.desc: A signal or an event that should have been the start of an action (sequence) is missed.

sc.name: Overlook measurement
sc.desc: A measurement or some information is missed, usually during a sequence of actions.

sc.name: False reaction
sc.desc: A response is given to an incorrect stimulus or event, e.g. starting to drive when the light changes to red.

sc.name: False recognition
sc.desc: An event or some information is incorrectly recognised or mistaken for something else.

sc.name: Mistaken cue
sc.desc: A signal or a cue is misunderstood as something else. The difference from "false reaction" is that it does not immediately lead to an action

sc.name: Partial identification
sc.desc: The identification of an event or some information is incomplete, e.g. as in jumping to a conclusion

sc.name: Incorrect identification
sc.desc: The identification of an event or some information is incorrect. The difference from "false recognition" is that identification is a more deliberate process.

sc.name: Wrong diagnosis
sc.desc: The diagnosis of the situation or system state is incorrect.

sc.name: Incomplete diagnosis
sc.desc: The diagnosis of the situation or system state is incomplete.

sc.name: Induction error
sc.desc: Faulty reasoning involving inferences or generalisations (going from specific to general), leading to invalid results.

sc.name: Deduction error
sc.desc: Faulty reasoning involving deduction (going from general to specific), leading to invalid results.

sc.name: Wrong priorities
sc.desc: The selection among alternatives (hypothesis, explanations, interpretations) using incorrect criteria, hence leading to invalid results.

sc.name: Decision paralysis
sc.desc: Inability to make a decision in a situation.

sc.name: Wrong decision
sc.desc: Making the wrong decision (typically about action alternatives).

sc.name: Partial decision
sc.desc: Making a decision that does not completely specify what to do, hence creates a need for further decisions to complete the course of action.

sc.name: No identification
sc.desc: An identification is not made in time (for appropriate action to be taken).

sc.name: Increased time pressure
sc.desc: An identification is not made fast enough, e.g. because the reasoning involved is difficult, leading to a time pressure.

sc.name: Unexpected state change
sc.desc: A state change occurred which had not been anticipated.

sc.name: Unexpected side-effects
sc.desc: The event developed in the main as anticipated, but some side-effects had been overlooked.

sc.name: Process speed misjudged
sc.desc: The speed of development (of the system) has been misjudged, so things happen either too slowly or too fast.

sc.name: Incomplete plan
sc.desc: The plan is not complete, i.e., it does not contain all the details needed when it is carried out. This can have serious consequences later in time.

sc.name: Wrong plan
sc.desc: The plan is wrong, in the sense that it will not achieve its purpose.

sc.name: Wrong goal selected
sc.desc: The goal has been wrongly selected, and the plan will therefore not be effective (cf. the conventional definition of a mistake).

sc.name: Forgotten
sc.desc: An item or some information cannot be recalled when needed.

sc.name: Incorrect recall
sc.desc: Information is incorrectly recalled (e.g. the wrong name for something).

sc.name: Incomplete recall
sc.desc: Information is only recalled partially, i.e., part of the information is missing.

sc.name: Random actions
sc.desc: Actions do not seem to follow any plan or principle, but rather look like trial-and-error.

sc.name: Action freeze
sc.desc: The person is paralysed, i.e., unable to move or act.

sc.name: Task suspended
sc.desc: The performance of a task is suspended because the person's attention was caught by something else.

sc.name: Task not completed
sc.desc: The performance of a task is not completed because of a shift in attention.

sc.name: Goal forgotten
sc.desc: The person cannot remember why something is being done. This may cause a repetition of previous steps.

sc.name: Loss of orientation
sc.desc: The person cannot remember or think of what to do next or what happened before.

sc.name: Delayed response
sc.desc: The person's response speed (physically or mentally) is reduced due to fatigue.

sc.name: Lack of precision
sc.desc: Reduced precision of actions, e.g. in reaching a target value.

sc.name: Increasing misses
sc.desc: An increasing number of actions fails to achieve their purpose.

sc.name: Signal missed
sc.desc: A signal or an event was missed due to inattention. This is similar to "observation missed", the difference being whether it is seen as a random event or something that can be explained by a cognitive function.

sc.name: Many specific effects
sc.desc: A general condition caused by physiological stress. This may have many specific effects.

sc.name: Many specific effects
sc.desc: A general condition caused by psychological stress. This may have many specific effects.

sc.name: Simultaneous scanning
sc.desc: Search for data and information is accomplished by looking for several things at the same time.

sc.name: Successive scanning
sc.desc: Search for data and information is accomplished by looking at one thing at a time.

sc.name: Conservative focusing
sc.desc: Search for data and information starts from an assumption of which the various aspects are examined one by one.

sc.name: Focus gambling
sc.desc: The search for data or information changes in an opportunistic way, rather than systematically.

sc.name: Incorrect revision of probabilities
sc.desc: New information does not lead to a proper adjustment of probabilities - either a conservative or a too radical effect.

sc.name: Hindsight bias
sc.desc: Interpretation of past events is influenced by knowledge of the outcome.

sc.name: Attribution error
sc.desc: Event are (mistakenly) seen as being caused by specific phenomena or factors.

sc.name: Illusion of control
sc.desc: Person mistakenly believes that the chosen actions control the developments in the system.

sc.name: Confirmation bias
sc.desc: Search for data or information is restricted to that which will confirm current assumptions.

sc.name: Hypothesis fixation
sc.desc: Search for information and action alternatives is constrained by a strong hypothesis about what the current problem is.

sc.name: Actuator stick/slip
sc.desc: An actuator or a control either cannot be moved or moves too easily.

sc.name: Blocking
sc.desc: Something obstructs or is in the way of an action.

sc.name: Breakage
sc.desc: An actuator or a control or another piece of equipment breaks.

sc.name: Release
sc.desc: Uncontrolled release of matter or energy that causes other equipment to fail.

sc.name: Speed-up / slow-down
sc.desc: The speed of a process (e.g. a flow) changes significantly.

sc.name: No indications
sc.desc: An equipment failure occurs without a clear signature.

sc.name: Performance slow-down
sc.desc: The performance of the system slows down. This can in particular be critical for command and control.

sc.name: Information delays
sc.desc: There are delays in the transmission of information, hence in the efficiency of communication, both within the system and between systems.

sc.name: Command queues
sc.desc: Commands or actions are not being carried out because the system is unstable, but are (presumably) stacked.

sc.name: Information not available
sc.desc: Information is not available due to software or other problems.

sc.name: Ambiguous text
sc.desc: The text of the procedure is ambiguous and open to interpretation. The logic of the procedure may be unclear.

sc.name: Incomplete text
sc.desc: The descriptions given by the procedure are incomplete, and assume the user has specific additional knowledge.

sc.name: Incorrect text
sc.desc: The descriptions of the procedure are factually incorrect.

sc.name: Mismatch to actual equipment
sc.desc: The procedure text does not match the physical reality, due to e.g. equipment upgrades.

sc.name: Item cannot be reached
sc.desc: An item is permanently out of reach, e.g. too high, too low, or too far away from the operator's working position.

sc.name: Item cannot be found
sc.desc: An item is permanently difficult to find. Infrequently used items that are inappropriately labelled fall into this category.

sc.name: Position mismatch
sc.desc: There is a mismatch between the indicated positions of an item and the actual position, e.g. controls have unusual movements.

sc.name: Coding mismatch
sc.desc: There is a mismatch in coding, e.g. in the use of colour or shape. This may lead to difficulties in the use of equipment.

sc.name: [Incomplete information]
sc.desc: The information provided by the interface is incomplete, e.g. error messages, directions, warnings, etc.

sc.name: Item cannot be reached
sc.desc: An item, e.g. a control, cannot be reached, for instance because it is hidden by something or due to a change in the operator's working postion.

sc.name: Item cannot be found
sc.desc: An item, information or a control, cannot be located when it is needed or it is temporarily unavailable.

sc.name: Incorrect information
sc.desc: The labelling or identification of an item is not correct.

sc.name: Ambiguous identification
sc.desc: The labelling or identification of an item is open to interpretation.

sc.name: Language error
sc.desc: The labelling or identification of an item is incorrectly, formulated, or is written in a foreign language.

sc.name: Message not received
sc.desc: The message or the transmission of information did not reach the receiver. This could be due to incorrect address or failure of communication channels.

sc.name: Message misunderstood
sc.desc: The message was received, but it was misunderstood. The misunderstanding is, however, not deliberate.

sc.name: No information
sc.desc: Information is not being given when it was needed or requested, e.g. missing feedback.

sc.name: Incorrect information
sc.desc: The information being given is incorrect or incomplete.

sc.name: Misunderstanding
sc.desc: There is a misunderstanding between sender and receiver about the purpose, form or structure of the communication.

sc.name: Equipment not operational
sc.desc: Equipment (controls, resources) does not function or is not available due to missing or inappropriate management.

sc.name: Indicators not working
sc.desc: Indications (lights, signals) do not work properly due to missing maintenance.

sc.name: Inadequate procedures
sc.desc: Equipment / functions is not adequate due to insufficient quality control.

sc.name: Inadequate reserves
sc.desc: Lack of resources or supplies (e.g. inventory, back-up equipment, etc.)

sc.name: Unclear roles
sc.desc: People in the organisation are not clear about their roles and duties.

sc.name: Dilution of responsibility
sc.desc: There is not clear distribution or responsibility; this is particularly important in abnormal situations.

sc.name: Unclear line of command
sc.desc: The line of command is not well defined and control of the situation may be lost.

sc.name: Anthropometric mismatch
sc.desc: The working environment is inadequate, and the cause is clearly a design failure.

sc.name: Inadequate MMI
sc.desc: The interface is inadequate, and the cause is clearly a design failure.

sc.name: Inadequate managerial rules
sc.desc: The organisation of work is deficient due to the lack of clear rules or principles.

sc.name: Inadequate task planning
sc.desc: Task planning/ scheduling is deficient.

sc.name: Inadequate work procedure
sc.desc: Procedures for how work should be carried out are inadequate.

sc.name: Group think
sc.desc: The individual's situation understanding is guided or controlled by the group.

sc.name: Performance failure
sc.desc: Lack of skills (practical experience) means that a task cannot be accomplished.

sc.name: Equipment mishandling
sc.desc: Lack of skills (practical experience) means that equipment is incorrectly used.

sc.name: Confusion
sc.desc: The person is not quite certain about what to do, due to lack of knowledge.

sc.name: Loss of situation awareness
sc.desc: The person has lost general situation awareness (understanding) due to lack of knowledge.

sc.name: Too hot
sc.desc: Uncomfortably warm.

sc.name: Too cold
sc.desc: Uncomfortably cold.

sc.name: Too loud
sc.desc: Noise level is too high.

sc.name: Too soft
sc.desc: Signal level is too low.

sc.name: Too dry
sc.desc: Uncomfortably dry.

sc.name: Too humid
sc.desc: Uncomfortably humid.

sc.name: Too bright
sc.desc: High luminosity, glare, reflection.

sc.name: Too dark
sc.desc: Low luminosity, reduced colour and contrast.

sc.name: Vibration
sc.desc: There may be other "dimensions", depending on the specific type of work.

sc.name: [None defined]
sc.desc: Highly context dependent, may coincide with some of the Common Performance Conditions

sc.name: None defined
sc.desc: Excessive task demands or insufficient time / resources.

sc.name: Narrow work space
sc.desc: Available work space is not large enough for the required activities. This is often the case for maintenance work.

sc.name: Dangerous work space
sc.desc: Work must be carried out in dangerous conditions, e.g. high voltage line work, radiation, unstable mass or energy storage, etc.

sc.name: Elevated work space
sc.desc: Work must be carried out where there is a risk of falling down.

sc.name: Unclear job description
sc.desc: The roles within the team are not well defined or well understood.

sc.name: Inadequate communication
sc.desc: The distribution of work / responsibilities within the team is not mutually agreed.

sc.name: Lack of team cohesiveness
sc.desc: There is little cohesiveness in the team, hence little collaboration.

sc.name: Circadian rhythm effects
sc.desc: Shift work leading to disturbances of physiological and psychological functions (jet lag, lack of sleep, etc.).
